simulated_ratings.title: Dumbo (1941)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet, melancholy, and charming without outstaying its welcome.

simulated_ratings.title: Duck Amuck (1953)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brilliantly anarchic meta-gag machine that still feels fresh.

simulated_ratings.title: Thing from Another World, The (1951)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, icy siege horror with crackling pace and atmosphere.

simulated_ratings.title: Ballad of Narayama, The (Narayama Bushiko) (1958)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Formal, austere and affecting, though the Kabuki stylization kept me at a remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Monsters, Inc. (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inventive world-building with heart that lands more often than it cloys.

simulated_ratings.title: Up (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Opening wallop hits hard, the adventure that follows is lively if a bit tidy.

simulated_ratings.title: For the Birds (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharp, wordless slapstick with a satisfying sting.

simulated_ratings.title: Winnie the Pooh and the Honey Tree (1966)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle and cozy, a pleasant amble rather than a standout.

simulated_ratings.title: Brave Little Toaster, The (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whimsical and unexpectedly wistful, with a nice melancholic undercurrent.

simulated_ratings.title: Fantasia (1940)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A sumptuous marriage of image and music that rewards surrendering to it.

simulated_ratings.title: Shrek (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever and irreverent, though the pop-culture snark dates it some.

simulated_ratings.title: Three from Prostokvashino (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Simple, amiable charm with a quietly rebellious streak.

simulated_ratings.title: Don't Hug Me, I'm Scared II: Time (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Playfully nightmarish and pointed, its unease lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: Finding Nemo (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Beautifully crafted and engaging, sentimental but not saccharine.

simulated_ratings.title: Navigator, The (1924)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ingenious set-pieces, even if the feature-length stretch is uneven for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh, The (1977)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, gently magical vignettes that drift along agreeably.

simulated_ratings.title: Dogville (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Severe and gripping in concept and cruelty, admirable more than lovable.

simulated_ratings.title: Yi Yi (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quietly observant and humane, rewarding patience with small, true moments.

simulated_ratings.title: Bear, The (Ours, L') (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lyrical and spare, with nature’s danger and tenderness well observed.

simulated_ratings.title: Pinocchio (1940)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darkly whimsical moral fable with marvelous craft and a few haunting images.

simulated_ratings.title: Sweet Smell of Success (1957)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Abrasive, razor-sharp and smoky

simulated_ratings.title: High Tension (Haute tension) (Switchblade Romance) (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brutal and effective in stretches, but the big swing leaves me cold.

simulated_ratings.title: Toy Story (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Playful, fleet, and witty

simulated_ratings.title: Steamboat Willie (1928)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Historically nifty and jaunty, more curio than knockout.

simulated_ratings.title: There Once Was a Dog (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Folktale warmth with a sly wink and lovely economy.

simulated_ratings.title: Frankenweenie (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet idea, but the Burton pastiche feels more cute than compelling.

simulated_ratings.title: Germany Year Zero (Germania anno zero) (Deutschland im Jahre Null) (1948)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stark and sobering, its desolation is bracing if remote.

simulated_ratings.title: Naked (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Scalding, bleakly funny, and magnetic in its vitriol.

simulated_ratings.title: Toy Story 2 (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Spry and clever with genuine pathos, a rare sequel that holds its own.

recommended_movies: Kids in the Hall: Brain Candy (1996)
Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan (2006)
Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984)

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy 5: Assignment: Miami Beach (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Florida sun can't thaw the stale gags—thin, tired, and noisy.

simulated_ratings.title: Smokey and the Bandit III (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Listless retread coasting on fumes, chase without charm.

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy 6: City Under Siege (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Jokes on autopilot, the mugging outpaces any wit.

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy 4: Citizens on Patrol (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Civilians in, laughs out—telegraphed pratfalls ad nauseam.

simulated_ratings.title: Lost in America (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brooks’ prickly, rueful satire hits a sweet spot of cringe and insight.

simulated_ratings.title: Throw Momma from the Train (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A scruffy, Hitchcock-y lark with a dark giggle and some rough patches.

simulated_ratings.title: Kids in the Hall: Brain Candy (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sour, surreal, and cheerfully nasty—scattershot but inspired.

simulated_ratings.title: Little Fockers (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Strained farce wrung dry, all reflex and no spark.

simulated_ratings.title: Rink, The (1916)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy slapstick showcase—light, nimble, and slight.

simulated_ratings.title: Gremlins 2: The New Batch (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loony, anarchic cartoon chaos I mostly relish.

simulated_ratings.title: Fletch Lives (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smirky mystery-lite that coasts instead of crackles.

simulated_ratings.title: Holy Smoke (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Messy power-play psychodrama—abrasive, intriguing, uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: Ninth Gate, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Plush, smoky occult noodling with a sly grin and soft landing.

simulated_ratings.title: Bitter Moon (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Acrid, indulgent eros-and-cruelty tale—compelling in fits.

simulated_ratings.title: Ruthless People (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A brash, mean-spirited farce that clicks more than it clunks.

simulated_ratings.title: Night at the Roxbury, A (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: One joke on loop until the beat finally numbs.

simulated_ratings.title: Ghostbusters II (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A genial, goopy rerun with a few charming bursts.

simulated_ratings.title: Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Blistering, cringe-funny provocation that lands more hits than misses.

simulated_ratings.title: Husbands (1970)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Raw, rambling midlife howl—grating and genuine in equal measure.

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy 3: Back in Training (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slightly less dire, still mostly dead air.

simulated_ratings.title: 52 Pick-Up (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy, muscular thriller with sturdy snap if little surprise.

simulated_ratings.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breathless pulp ride—spectacle high, taste and cohesion wobbly.

simulated_ratings.title: Brüno (Bruno) (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Provocation tilts toward repetition

simulated_ratings.title: Command and Control (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A chilling, precise procedural that hums with slow-burn dread.

simulated_ratings.title: The Manor (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Decent premise, faint chills—serviceable rather than haunting.

simulated_ratings.title: Little Shop of Horrors (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Snappy, macabre musical fun with a wicked grin.

simulated_ratings.title: Dressed to Kill (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stylish, lurid clockwork—immersion outweighs the sleaze.

simulated_ratings.title: Whole Ten Yards, The (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A weary, witless victory lap no one needed.

simulated_ratings.title: Wild Hunt, The (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Role-play curdled into tragedy—earnest, rough-edged, effective.

simulated_ratings.title: Reluctant Debutante, The (1958)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Featherlight manners and mild fizz—pleasant, not potent.

Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones (2002)
Halloween III: Season of the Witch (1982)
Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith (2005)

simulated_ratings.title: Blair Witch Project, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A lean, dread-soaked exercise in suggestion that creeps under the skin.

simulated_ratings.title: Georgia (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Painfully observed spiral of need and self-sabotage—raw, credible, wearying.

simulated_ratings.title: Miami Vice (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek and serious but emotionally chilly

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings, The (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grand quest sketched in broad, mythic strokes—engaging if emotionally distant.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy space opera weighed down by stiffness and overbusy incident.

simulated_ratings.title: Saw V (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mechanistic cruelty dressed as puzzle—numbing rather than tense.

simulated_ratings.title: Kids (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Unvarnished and abrasive, a hard watch that feels grimly authentic.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clanking romance and CG bustle smother the adventure’s spark.

simulated_ratings.title: Saw VI (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A grim treadmill of traps that mistakes escalation for suspense.

simulated_ratings.title: Halloween III: Season of the Witch (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Weird, autumnal paranoia with a pleasingly sinister, off-kilter vibe.

simulated_ratings.title: Alien: Resurrection (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pulpy, rubbery sci-fi horror fun in flashes, but the slickness dulls the dread.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Operatic and doom-laden, yet still more impressive than moving for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Babe: Pig in the City (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darkly whimsical and tender, surprisingly poignant amid the bustle.

simulated_ratings.title: Wicker Man, The (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy and blunt, it strains for menace while the mystery goes flat.

simulated_ratings.title: Rocky Horror Picture Show, The (1975)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cheeky, campy rock musical delirium—uneven but exuberantly alive.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breathless plot-pinball with little room for wonder or resonance.

simulated_ratings.title: Living Daylights, The (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clean, sturdy spy thrills with a cool edge—solid, not stirring.

simulated_ratings.title: Alien: Covenant (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Handsome, somber monster tale whose grand ideas outpace its grip.

simulated_ratings.title: Wolf Creek (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, mean survival horror—effective in patches, hard to enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Paul Taylor Creative Domain (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Unfussy, patient process doc that quietly illuminates craft.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Trek: Insurrection (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Genial, small-stakes space adventure that coasts more than compels.

simulated_ratings.title: Die Another Day (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gadgety excess and cartoon stakes leave the spycraft weightless.

simulated_ratings.title: Texas Chainsaw Massacre, The (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy and relentless, more bludgeon than dread.

simulated_ratings.title: Honey Baby (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Wistful road romance with gentle charm, slight and meandering.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Trek: First Contact (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek, propulsive Trek with a satisfying menace and momentum.

simulated_ratings.title: Alien³ (a.k.a. Alien 3) (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, spare survival piece—atmosphere strong even as it stumbles.

simulated_ratings.title: Matrix Revolutions, The (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Thundering spectacle with a weary, airless finale feel.

simulated_ratings.title: A Fall From Grace (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Twisty potboiler energy undermined by creaky plotting and staging.

simulated_ratings.title: House of 1000 Corpses (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grindhouse shriek-show—loud, garish, and more trying than thrilling.

simulated_ratings.title: Saw (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Nasty, gimmicky cat-and-mouse that favors gotcha over genuine tension.

simulated_ratings.title: Beavis and Butt-Head Do America (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dopey, rambunctious road cartoon with enough inspired stupidity to amuse.

simulated_ratings.title: Bill Burr: Why Do I Do This? (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Acerbic, sharp-eyed rants land regularly, even if a few beats feel familiar.

simulated_ratings.title: Bill Hicks: Sane Man (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ferocious, focused set—caustic, funny, and bracingly alive.

simulated_ratings.title: Cruise, The (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A hypnotic, affectionate character study fueled by rapid-fire patter.

simulated_ratings.title: Shrek Forever After (a.k.a. Shrek: The Final Chapter) (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Alternate-universe hook perks it up, but it still feels like a tidy rerun.

simulated_ratings.title: Most Dangerous Man in America: Daniel Ellsberg and the Pentagon Papers, The (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clear, compelling civics thriller that informs without dulling the stakes.

simulated_ratings.title: Jackass: The Movie (2002)

simulated_ratings.title: Jackass Number Two (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bigger, grosser escalation that numbs as often as it tickles.

simulated_ratings.title: Used Cars (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brash, scrappy farce with a satisfying mean streak and hustle.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers (1993)

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Best of Aardman Animation (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A charming, crafty sampler—varied but consistently witty and warm.

simulated_ratings.title: Jackass 3D (2010)

simulated_ratings.title: Sick: The Life & Death of Bob Flanagan, Supermasochist (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Provocative and intimate—tough to watch, hard to shake.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace and Gromit in 'A Matter of Loaf and Death' (2008)

simulated_ratings.title: Rango (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Handsome, oddball western pastiche—clever more than affecting.

simulated_ratings.title: The Mitten (1967)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Simple, tender whimsy with a lovely handmade glow.

simulated_ratings.title: Remains of the Day, The (1993)

simulated_ratings.title: Chicken Run (2000)

simulated_ratings.title: Ghost and Mr. Chicken, The (1966)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Genial spooky lark—pleasant shivers, mild laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Maniac (1980)

simulated_ratings.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2 (2015)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Sun-baked small-town yearning—handsome, earnest, a bit stiff.

simulated_ratings.title: Communion (1989)

simulated_ratings.title: Edge of Extinction (2020)
